## Personal Injury

Request a Consultation

**If you have been injured in an accident in Marathon County or elsewhere in
North Central Wisconsin, our attorneys can help you seek rightful compensation
for your medical bill and other losses. Contact us today for a free
consultation.**

## Dedicated Wausau, WI Personal Injury Attorneys

A serious accident can change your life in an instant. From medical bills and
the interference with your daily routine to the long-term physical and
emotional effects, accident-related injuries can touch almost every aspect of
your life. If you are suffering and someone else is to blame, you deserve to
be compensated for your losses.

We provide experienced and aggressive legal representation for accident
victims in Marathon County and throughout North Central Wisconsin. If you have
been injured in an accident caused by someone else’s negligence, our attorneys
can help you fight to recover maximum compensation for your losses. The
insurance companies put their interests first and have defense lawyers who
will be fighting to make sure that you receive as little as possible. To
protect yourself, you need a trusted advocate on your side.

## Cases We Handle

Our attorneys represent clients who have suffered injuries in all types of
accidents in North Central Wisconsin. The types of personal injury cases that
we handle include, **but are not limited to:**

  * Auto accidents (including distracted driving and drunk driving collisions)
  * Slips and falls
  * Dog bites
  * Medical mistakes

## Compensation Available to Personal Injury Victims in Wisconsin

Depending on the extent of your injuries, you could be entitled to significant
financial compensation, as a result of your accident. Many people do not
realize the full extent of their losses, and they unfortunately end up bearing
the financial burden, as well as the physical and emotional tolls of someone
else’s mistake.

If you were injured in an accident where someone else was fully or partially
at-fault, we may be able to help you recover financial compensation for your:

  * Medical bills
  * Future medical, therapy and rehabilitation costs
  * Lost income and lost future earning capacity
  * Pain and suffering
  * Emotional distress
  * Loss of enjoyment of life
  * Loss of spousal relations, support, care, and companionship

When you contact us about your case, we will conduct a thorough investigation
in order to determine the full extent of your losses so that we can seek the
largest possible settlement. If a fair settlement isn’t on the table, we will
go to court to protect your legal rights.

## Steps to Take After an Accident

There are a number of important steps that individuals should take after being
injured in an accident. When you contact us, our attorneys will walk you
through everything that you need to do, in order to preserve your claim for
compensation.

After an accident in North Central Wisconsin, you should:

### 1\. Seek prompt medical attention.

See a doctor, even if you think that you feel fine. Many accident victims do
not experience symptoms immediately, and seeking prompt medical attention will
be important to your personal injury claim.

### 2\. Take photos.

If you are able, take photos of everything possible. This includes the
location where you were injured, vehicle damage (in the case of a car
accident), damage to your clothes, and your physical injuries.

### 3\. Talk to witnesses.

Try to collect contact information from any witnesses at the scene of the
accident. These individuals may be able to provide important information to
assist in your claim for compensation.

### 4\. Write down everything that you remember.

Write down everything that you can remember. No detail is too small, and
taking notes now can help you remember what happened, should you need to
testify in the future.

### 5\. Avoid giving statements to the insurance companies.

The insurance companies will most likely ask you to make recorded statements.
You want to avoid doing so until you speak with an attorney.

## No Fee Unless You Win

Our attorneys handle personal injury cases on a contingency-fee basis. This
means that you do not pay any legal fees, unless we help you secure financial
compensation. We are confident in our abilities, and won’t waste your time (or
take your money) if we don’t believe that you have a case. To find out if you
have a claim for compensation, request a free consultation today.
